statement.p: Consider a lake whose center is located at \displaystyle{\left({0},{0}\right)}. Let \displaystyle{f{{\left({x},{y}\right)}}} be a function that determines the amount of pollutant in a lake at point \displaystyle{\left({x},{y}\right)}, which is located \displaystyle{x} meters east and \displaystyle{y} meters north of the center of the lake.
Choose the best interpretation for \displaystyle\nabla{f{{\left({0},{0}\right)}}} concerning the center of the lake.

ol.li: It indicates the direction in which the pollution decreases the fastest.
It indicates the direction in which pollution is constant.
It indicates how polluted the lake is at the center.
It is the rate of change of the pollution.
It indicates the direction in which pollution increases the fastest.

ul.li: E: It indicates the direction in which pollution increases the fastest.
